page.text: 156 South Collins Court
Blackwood, NJ 08012
Emerson College, Boston, MA
B.S. Print & Multimedia Journalism, 2011, Magna Cum Laude
Minor in Business Studies
Triton Regional High School, Runnemede, NJ, 2008

text.b: Senior Intern, Communications, Executive Office of Labor and Workforce Development,

page.text: - Compile press clips for distribution to state employees.
- Draft advisories and press releases and calendar event items.
- Contribute to Department’s “Jobs Blog.”
- Edit and fact-check press releases and update contact lists.

text.b: CAMERA (Committee for Accuracy in Middle East Reporting in America)

page.text: - Organize and coordinate on-campus events focused on Middle East reporting,
particularly the Arab-Israeli conflict
- Write Op/Eds on Middle East issues for publication.
- One of 25 Student Fellows from five different countries to be accepted into one-year
program.
- Visited Israel on a leadership mission to meet experts on the conflict and to explore
journalism topics, activism, and leadership strategies.
- Record expenditures and submit required paperwork to Student
GovernmentAssociation in a timely manner.
- Draft year-end report of Hillel expenses and fundraising for Financial Advisory Board.
- Organize/coordinate spiritual and educational Hillel events.
- Write news stories for weekly sports program.
- Edit video highlights with Avid for broadcast.
- Write segments for on-air specialist segments.

text.b: Reprographic & Mail Associate, Collegiate Press (Emerson Copy Center)

page.text: - Customer service, assist customers with copy, printing, graphic design, and binding
needs.
- Proficient in Microsoft and Mac platforms and applications, Photoshop, and InDesign.

text.b: Nature Specialist, JCC Camps at Medford

page.text: - Nature specialist and Counselor for 5th-8th grade campers over an eight-week
period.
- Develop and coordinate nature, outdoor, and environmentally-themed lesson plans
for weekly activities.

text.b: Jewish Vocational Services, Boston, MA (Work Study position)

page.text: - Teaching assistant in computer skills class. Assisted adults with computer and
Microsoft Office fundamentals for career building.
- Teaching assistant in adult GED class. Tutored adults in subjects of mathematics and
English to pass the MCAS standardized test to achieve high school diploma.
- Awarded for professionalism and dedication to the profession
- Awarded to juniors in the top 10 percent of their graduating class and seniors in the
top five percent of their graduating class.
- Awarded to Emerson students who have displayed strong leadership qualities on and
off-campus while maintaining strong academic progress.
- Team Captain, September 2009-December 2011
- Grace Kaskie Memorial Award for Leadership, 2012
- MVP, Men’s Cross Country, December 2008
- GNAC All-Conference Athlete, November 2009
- Team representative for Student Athletic Advisory Committee at Emerson College
- Helped lead team to best conference finishes in school history
- 2011 Boston Marathon Qualifier
